JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is a private NORP news agency and television company ( “ the applicant company ” ) that was set up in DATE and has its registered office in GPE . The applicant company was represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , PERSON , Mr PERSON , ORG and PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE , Mr PERSON and Ms PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE , and Mr A. PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant company was established in DATE and initially operated as a news agency , with its own publishing house , newspaper and internet network .

According to the applicant company , since DATE it had applied on several occasions to the relevant public authorities to obtain a broadcasting licence with the intention of getting involved in television broadcasting , but was repeatedly refused a licence .

On DATE the applicant company entered into an agreement with another private company , the ORG television company ( “ ORG ” ) , to jointly produce a set of the applicant company 's television programmes , which included re - broadcasts of the TVCARDINAL NORP television channel and its own programmes , comprising news , political and economic analysis and constituting PERCENT of the whole content . Under the terms of the agreement , ORG allowed the applicant company to broadcast over band CARDINAL , for which ORG held a broadcasting licence due to expire on DATE .
In DATE legislative changes were introduced in the sphere of television and radio broadcasting .

ORG ( « Հեռուստատեսության և ռադիոյի մասին ORG օրենք – “ the LAW ” ) , passed in DATE , established a new authority , ORG ( Հեռուստատեսության և ռադիոյի ազգային հանձնաժողով – “ the ORG ” ) , which was entrusted with regulating the licensing and monitoring the activities of private television and radio companies . The ORG was a public body composed of CARDINAL members appointed by the President of GPE . LAW also introduced a new licensing procedure , according to which a broadcasting licence was granted on the basis of a call for tenders conducted by the ORG in respect of the list of available frequencies .
During DATE all existing broadcasting licences were temporarily re - registered by the ORG until the relevant calls for tenders were announced .

On an unspecified date in DATE the ORG decided to postpone the call for tenders for band CARDINAL until the adoption of appropriate rules and regulations and to permit ORG to continue to operate on band CARDINAL for an indefinite period of time until such call for tenders was issued .

On DATE the ORG announced calls for tenders for various broadcasting frequencies , including band CARDINAL . The ORG issued a notice in which it defined the conditions for participation in the call for tenders for band CARDINAL and the information and documents to be submitted . The information required included data on the technical facilities , the financial sources , the staff and the programme policy of an applicant .

The applicant company and CARDINAL other companies , GPE and ORG , submitted bids for band CARDINAL . The applicant company alleged that GPE was a company producing predominantly clerical programmes , while PERSON TV focused mostly on entertainment programmes .
On DATE the ORG held a points - based vote and recognised PERSON as the winner of the call for tenders for band CARDINAL . The decision stated :

“ Based on [ the relevant provisions LAW and other complementary legal acts ] , and taking into account the results of the call for tenders for television broadcasting on decimetric band CARDINAL in the area of GPE , [ the ORG ] decides ( CARDINAL ) to recognise ORG as the winner of the call for tenders for television broadcasting on decimetric band CARDINAL in the area of GPE , and ( CARDINAL ) to grant a television broadcasting licence to ORG ”

On an unspecified date the manager of the applicant company , Mr GPE , lodged an application with ORG ( ՀՀ տնտեսական դատարան ) , claiming that the tender procedure had been conducted with violations of the law and seeking to invalidate its results . In particular , he argued that the ORG , by announcing separate calls for tenders for different bands as opposed to a single one for all bands , had restricted the applicant company 's right to win a licence for any of the unoccupied bands . He further argued that the information required by the ORG had not been consistent with the information to be contained in a bid for a broadcasting licence as defined by law . Moreover , the ORG had not been authorised by law to define the information to be contained in a bid . Furthermore , he submitted that the ORG had failed to inform the applicant company in writing about the reasons for the refusal of a licence .

On DATE ORG examined the applicant company 's application . The applicant company was represented at this hearing by CARDINAL lawyers , GPE , FAC and PERSON , who made submissions on its behalf . ORG decided to dismiss the application , finding that the fact that the ORG had announced separate calls for tenders as opposed to a single one did not contravene the law . Nothing had precluded the applicant company from submitting bids for all these calls for tenders . The court further found that the ORG had been authorised by law to define the procedures and conditions of the tender process and that it had acted in accordance with the law in doing so . Nothing in the information required by the ORG in its notice issued following the announcement of the call for tenders on DATE had conflicted with the requirements of the law . As to the requirement to provide a written notification of the reasons for the refusal of a licence , the court found that the ORG , having recognised PERSON as the winner of the competition , had informed the applicant company about this in writing on DATE .
On an unspecified date Mr GPE lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) . In his appeal , he raised the same arguments as before ORG
On DATE ORG notified the applicant company that its hearing was scheduled for DATE at TIME

On DATE lawyer PERSON informed ORG in writing that on DATE at TIME he had to appear at another court hearing . In order to avoid an overlap between the QUANTITY hearings , lawyer PERSON requested ORG to notify him of the exact time when the applicant company 's claim would be examined . It appears that no reply was received to this letter .

On DATE at TIME Mr GPE , accompanied by lawyers PERSON and FAC , appeared at ORG . The latter had CARDINAL cases scheduled for that date with all the parties involved being notified to appear at TIME . The hearings started at TIME

The applicant company alleged that at TIME lawyer PERSON requested the presiding judge to inform him as to when the hearing on the applicant company 's claim would commence . The presiding judge replied that the hearing would commence “ whenever the court found it necessary ” . The lawyer repeated his request , explaining about the need to prevent any overlap between the QUANTITY hearings , whereupon he was removed from the courtroom upon the instruction of the presiding judge for violating order in court . At TIME ORG proceeded to examining the applicant company 's case . The ORG was represented at the hearing by CARDINAL lawyers , while the applicant company was represented only by Mr GPE since lawyer ORG had not been instructed to represent the applicant company . The hearing lasted TIME . The parties were not asked any questions and did not make any submissions .

The Government contested this allegation , claiming that the applicant company 's lawyer was never removed from the courtroom . ORG had CARDINAL cases scheduled to be examined on DATE , starting at TIME was given to cases involving parties coming from distant regions and women . Having found out about this order , the lawyer informed the court that he had another hearing to attend at TIME and requested that the applicant company 's case be heard in a priority order . This request was refused so the lawyer voluntarily left the courtroom . The Government further alleged that the applicant company was represented by CARDINAL other lawyers , while the ORG had no representative .
ORG , and concluded by dismissing the applicant company 's appeal , finding that :

“ ... the arguments put forward in the appeal concerning a violation by ORG of [ the relevant legal acts ] are groundless , as [ the ORG ] , acting within the authority vested in it by the above legal acts ... defined the tender procedure for licensing of television broadcasting , which contains the rules on the conditions , procedures and time - limits of a call for tenders , submission of bids , recognising the winner of the call for tenders and declaring the call for tenders void . On DATE [ the ORG ] ... announced separate calls for tenders for unoccupied frequencies and on DATE in its decision no . CARDINAL recognised PERSON as the winner , about which it informed [ the applicant company in its letter ] of DATE .

... LAW ] guarantees the right to freedom of expression . LAW , however , does “ not prevent GPE from requiring the licensing of broadcasting , television or cinema enterprises ” . The arguments [ concerning a violation of LAW ] are also groundless , as ORG did not violate the requirements of [ this Article ] .

[ As to the improper examination of the applicant company 's claims by ORG , this argument is also groundless ] ... as the [ court ] ... evaluated each piece of evidence of the case in a detailed , thorough and objective manner . ”
The relevant provisions of the LAW , as in force at the material time , read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . [ ORG ] shall adopt a judgment when deciding on the merits of a dispute . ”

“ CARDINAL . When adopting a judgment [ ORG ] shall : ( CARDINAL ) assess the evidence ; ( CARDINAL ) determine which circumstances significant for the case have or have not been disclosed ; ( CARDINAL ) determine the laws and other legal acts applicable to the case ; and ( CARDINAL ) decide to fully or partially grant the claim or to dismiss it . ”

“ Unlawful acts of public authorities , local self - government bodies and their officials can be annulled or their actions ( inaction ) can be contested ( hereafter , annulling the unlawful act ) if the act in question contradicts the law and if there is evidence that the applicant 's rights and ( or ) freedoms guaranteed by LAW and laws have been violated . ”

“ CARDINAL . An application seeking to annul the unlawful acts of public authorities , local self - government bodies and their officials shall be submitted to a court dealing with civil cases or ORG , pursuant to their jurisdiction over the case .
CARDINAL . The submission of an application to a court does not suspend the effect of the contested act ... ”
“ An appeal on points of law can be lodged on ... the ground of a material or a procedural violation of the parties ' rights ... ”
“ CARDINAL . NORP The President of ORG shall instruct CARDINAL of the judges of the chambers of ORG to study the appeal and the case file ...
CARDINAL . NORP The judges of ORG shall be entitled to get acquainted with the appeal and the case file . ”
“ CARDINAL . The examination of a case in ORG shall start with the presentation by the judge rapporteur ...
The judge rapporteur shall [ contested ] judgment and the arguments raised in the appeal .
The judges of ORG shall be entitled to ask questions to the judge rapporteur .
CARDINAL . The appellant shall have the right to be present at the hearing before ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP If explanations are necessary , the appellant and other parties may be summoned to the hearing ... Their failure to appear shall not preclude the examination of the case . ”
“ The chamber of ORG shall review judgments and decisions within the grounds presented in the appeal . ”
“ Having examined a case , ORG has the right :
( CARDINAL ) to uphold the court judgment and to dismiss the appeal ... ;
( CARDINAL ) to quash the whole or part of the judgment and to remit the case for a new examination ... ;
( CARDINAL ) to terminate the proceedings or to leave the claim unexamined , if the grounds for [ doing so ] were disclosed during the proceedings in the court of first instance , ORG or ORG . ”
“ CARDINAL . ORG shall adopt a decision based on the results of the examination of the case .
CARDINAL . NORP The decision shall be adopted in the absence of the appellant and other persons summoned to the hearing to give explanations .
CARDINAL . The Court of Cassation shall be competent to adopt a decision if the majority of judges of the chamber of ORG are present .
CARDINAL . NORP The decision shall be adopted by an open vote .
The decision shall be considered adopted if the majority of the total number of judges present at the hearing voted for it .
CARDINAL . NORP The operative part of ORG decision shall be pronounced at the hearing . ”

“ CARDINAL . ORG is not entitled to establish or consider as proven circumstances which have not been established by the judgment [ of ORG ] or have been rejected by it , to determine whether or not this or that piece of evidence is trustworthy , to resolve the issue as to which piece of evidence has more weight or the issue as to which norm of substantive law must be applied and what kind of judgment must be adopted upon the new examination of the case . ”
The relevant provisions of LAW , as in force at the material time , read as follows :
“ In GPE television and radio broadcasting shall be conducted on the basis of a licence . ”

“ ORG ( hereafter , ORG ) is an independent body with the status of a public agency whose activity is regulated by this law , its regulations and the legislation of GPE . ORG deals with licensing and monitoring of only private television and radio companies ( television companies or radio companies ) .

ORG : ( a ) shall allocate broadcasting frequencies on a public and competitive basis and ensure the publication of complete information on the results of a call for tenders ; ... ( c ) shall grant licences ... ”
“ A television and radio broadcasting licence shall be granted for a particular available frequency on the basis of a call for tenders ... ”
“ When selecting the licence - holder , the ORG shall take into account :
( a ) the predominance of programmes produced in - house ;
( b ) the predominance of programmes produced in GPE ;
( c ) the technical and financial capacity of the applicant ; and
( d ) the professional level of the staff . ”
“ A licence shall not be granted if :
( a ) the applicant can not be a licence - holder pursuant to this law ;
( b ) the information contained in the bid is inaccurate ; or
( c ) the technical capacity for television and radio broadcasting is lacking or the declared technical capacity is insufficient .
An applicant shall be informed in writing of the reasons for the refusal of a licence within DATE from the date of the decision .
The refusal of a licence can be contested before the courts . ”
The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :

“ In order to grant a broadcasting licence , the ORG , at its meeting and within the period prescribed by the tendering rules , shall adopt a decision on the basis of the results of a call for tenders . ”
